page.title: 04DAIRY FARMERS AND NUTRITION
page.content: Another recent problem dairy farmers have had to face was brought about by nutrionists, who said that too much fat was dangerous causing heart attacks and that the culprit foods were mainly dairy products. With a health conscious public to cater to farmers found it difficult to get rid of produce and had to bring prices down to compete with low-fat products. Until then farmers had been encouraged to produce cows with a high butterfat content in their milk. Now they face the problem of breeding cows which produce less butterfat and more protein in their milk. All this takes time but the farmer has to act quickly to save his livelihood.
